result.execSummary:
The defendant Montavious Henderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Court granted Huber privileges for work. Court allows for Good Time Credit

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
COURT ALLOWS FOR EXPUNGEMENT IF THE DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES PROBATION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montavious Henderson

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work.  Court allows for good time credit. 

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Maintain employment.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Driver's license REVOKED for a period of 6 MONTHS. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 

*Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation. 

Court set restitution at $0.00.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Montavious Henderson in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Montavious Henderson.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Montavious Henderson in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III not in court.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court a plea and sentencing.  Court rescheduled the matter.  Parties notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Montavious Henderson in court.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Montavious Henderson.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Montavious Henderson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears by Zoom.  Original Information previously filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Montavious Henderson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Gregg Herman appears in person the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Arraignment scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Montavious Henderson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Montavious Henderson in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Montavious Henderson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
